TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XPathDocument extends System.Object implements class System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable

Docs.summary: Provides a fast, read-only, in-memory representation of an XML document by using the XPath data model.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about processing XML data by using the XPath data model, see the [Process XML Data Using the XPath Data Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) topic.

Docs.exception: An error was encountered in the XML data. The remains empty.
The <xref:System.IO.Stream> object passed as a parameter is .

Docs.param: The <xref:System.IO.TextReader> object that contains the XML data.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the XML data that is contained in the specified <xref:System.IO.TextReader> object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks After the <xref:System.IO.TextReader> object has been used to load XML data, the cursor of the <xref:System.IO.TextReader> object is positioned at the end of the data. The <xref:System.IO.TextReader> object must be reset to read through the data again.

Docs.exception: An error was encountered in the XML data. The remains empty.
The <xref:System.IO.TextReader> object passed as a parameter is .

Docs.param: The path of the file that contains the XML data.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the XML data in the specified file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To preserve white space, use the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor that accepts an <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object as a parameter.

Docs.exception: An error was encountered in the XML data. The remains empty.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Xml.XmlReader reader) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object that contains the XML data.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the XML data that is contained in the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object can be used to load a whole XML document or part of an XML document into an <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument>. To load part of an XML document into an <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument>, position the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object on the top XML node to load data from. When you create an <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument> by using the XPathDocument constructor, data is loaded from the current top node through all its siblings. Afterwards, the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> is positioned on the outer scope of the top XML node. Alternatively, you can use the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.ReadSubtree%2A> method to load the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument> into a particular element in the XML document.
The following are important notes to consider when you use the XPathDocument constructor.
- An <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object with the appropriate associated <xref:System.Xml.XmlResolver> object settings can be used to resolve entities or other references in XML data.
- If the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object is positioned on a leaf node that is not valid for the root level of a document—for example, a white space or attribute node—the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object continues to read until it is positioned on a node that can be used for the root. The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument> begins loading at this point.
- To preserve white space, use the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor that accepts an <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object as a parameter.

Docs.exception: An error was encountered in the XML data. The remains empty.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object passed as a parameter is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string uri, valuetype System.Xml.XmlSpace space) cil managed

Docs.param: The path of the file that contains the XML data.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the XML data in the file specified with the white space handling specified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
- The <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object passed as a parameter specifies whether to preserve white space. <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> preserves only significant white space; <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> preserves all white space. By default, the <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object is set to <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace>.
- The functionality of the XPathDocument constructor is identical to that of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor, except for the white space handling options described.

Docs.exception: An error was encountered in the XML data. The remains empty.
The file path parameter or <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object parameter is .

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the XML data that is contained in the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object with the specified white space handling.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
- The <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object passed as a parameter specifies whether to preserve white space. <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> preserves only significant white space; <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> preserves all white space. By default, the <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace> object is set to <xref:System.Xml.XmlSpace>.
- The functionality of the XPathDocument constructor is identical to that of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument.%23ctor%2A> constructor, except for the white space handling options described.

Docs.exception: An error was encountered in the XML data. The remains empty.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator CreateNavigator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a read-only object for navigating through nodes in this .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> is positioned on the root element of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument>. If there is no root element, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> is positioned on the first element in the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathDocument>.
